overview.description: Punjab, located in northern India, is known for its rich culture, fertile plains, and Sikh heritage. Established as a state on November 1, 1966, it features attractions like Amritsar and Chandigarh.

top_destinations.name: Amritsar
top_destinations.description: Home to the Golden Temple and Wagah Border.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit Golden Temple; attend Wagah ceremony.

top_destinations.name: Chandigarh
top_destinations.description: A planned city with Rock Garden and Sukhna Lake.

top_destinations.name: Anandpur Sahib
top_destinations.description: A holy city with historical significance.
top_destinations.travel_tips: Visit during Hola Mohalla; respect traditions.

culinary_delights.name: Bharawan Da Dhaba
culinary_delights.description: Known for sarson da saag and makki di roti.

culinary_delights.name: Café Coffee Day
culinary_delights.description: Cozy spot for coffee and snacks.

culinary_delights.name: Pavilion
culinary_delights.description: Popular for Indian and Punjabi fusion.

must_visit_spots.name: Golden Temple
must_visit_spots.description: A sacred Sikh shrine in Amritsar.

must_visit_spots.name: Wagah Border
must_visit_spots.description: Famous for the beating retreat ceremony.
must_visit_spots.tip: Arrive early for a good view.

must_visit_spots.name: Rock Garden
must_visit_spots.description: An art park made of waste materials.

must_visit_spots.name: Jallianwala Bagh
must_visit_spots.description: A historical site commemorating a massacre.

must_visit_spots.name: Anandpur Sahib Fort
must_visit_spots.description: A historical fort with cultural significance.

travel_essentials.how_to_reach: By road: Amritsar is 450 km from Delhi (NH44, 8-9 hrs). By train: Amritsar Junction. By air: Sri Guru Ram Dass Jee Airport.
travel_essentials.tips: Carry warm clothing; avoid summer heat.
